definition: to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world
shake/trembling
essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
God/abbr. for 神舟[Shen2 zhou1]
deity/soul/spirit/unusual/mysterious/lively/expressive/expression/look/CL:個|个[ge4]/(slang) awesome/amazing

sentences.english: Starting into activity, he bundled the policemen into the dining-room doorway.
sentences.chinese: 他抖擞精神，把警察推到餐室门口。

sentences.english: No doubt this has helped the Celtic Tiger purr again.
sentences.chinese: 这无疑已帮助这只“凯尔特之虎”再度抖擞精神。

definition: to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
to raise one's spirits/to take courage
having high fighting spirit
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
to rise vigorously/a spirited start
brimming with confidence (idiom)
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
lit. to reorganize flags and drums (idiom); to regroup after a setback/to prepare for new initiatives/to attempt a comeback
to shout an order or command
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to have no alternative/to be helpless
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
to beat the gong to recall troops (idiom); to order a retreat
